metadata.title: CVE-2023-37920 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - negligible
metadata.description: Certifi is a curated collection of Root Certificates for validating thetrustworthiness of SSL certificates while verifying the identity of TLShosts. Certifi prior to version 2023.07.22 recognizes "e-Tugra" rootcertificates. e-Tugra's root certificates were subject to an investigationprompted by reporting of security issues in their systems. Certifi2023.07.22 removes root certificates from "e-Tugra" from the root store.

criterions.comment: python-certifi: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'see notes').
python-pip: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'see notes').
